title: 一人一信,寄俾聯合國人權專員

replies.msg:
由六月九號103萬人遊行到六月十二號警方使用過分武力大規模清場。警方越做越過份。

我draft左封信，大家過過目。
目的都係希望搵多啲人，一人一信對爆聯合國人權專員個email
請佢地就中國政府、香港政府及香港警察所使用嘅暴力及破壞人權展開獨立調查。

希望各位巴絲幫幫手，一人一信。




Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights


Dear Madame Bachelet,

I am a citizen of Hong Kong, I am sure you have read the wide coverage of the protests that are happening in Hong Kong. The protests are staged against the introduction of the proposed Extradition Bill by the HK SAR Government.

A large crowd of people numbered in excess of 1 million marched on June 9 protesting this bill which we think will jeopardise the semi-autonomous status of HK special administrative region as well as undermining its current independent judiciary.

The protests were all conducted in peaceful manners, the participants came from all walks of life. In anticipation of mild crowd-control measure such as tear gas from the law enforcement, the crowd only equipped themselves with umbrella and bicycle helmet. However, in the protests conducted on June 12, Hong Kong Police used unexpected excessive forces on the crowd, they used plastic bullets at close range without warning, fired more than 150 tear gas bombs, deployed water cannon on a lone protestor and brutally hit at protestors with batons who fell onto the ground while retreating.

The level of force used was unjustifiably disproportionate; we urge your office to open an investigation for the below acts of violation of Human Rights on the indigenous people of Hong Kong committed by the Chinese government, Hong Kong Government and Hong Kong Police :

1. the potential violations entailed by the introduction of the Extradition Bill

2. the atrocity committed by Hong Kong Police on peaceful HK protestors

3. uphold the rights of the citizens of Hong Kong for freedom of demonstrations and 4. reversal of the official verdict of the government on the nature of the protests

We have a large repertoire of footage and witness reports regarding these protests to substantiate our claims, please revert and we shall provide the relevant information to you.

Yours Sincerely,
XXXXX



以下係聯合國人權專員email:
Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights

InfoDesk@ohchr.org General

civilsociety@ohchr.org NGO

unvfvt@ohchr.org The UN Voluntary Fund for Victims of Torture

Send 埋去澳洲人權公會

complaintsinfo@humanrights.gov.au

國際人道法的基本規則

失去戰鬥能力、已退出戰鬥及未直接參與戰鬥的人士，其生命及身心健全均有權受到尊重。在任何情況下，他們都應受到不加任何不利區別的保護與人道對待。

禁止殺害或傷害投降或已退出戰鬥的敵人。

衝突各方應集合在其控制下的傷者和病者，加以照顧。保護對象還應涵蓋醫務人員、醫療設施、醫務運輸及醫療設備。白底紅十字或紅新月標誌，即為保護生命及財物的符號，必須予以保護。

在敵對一方控制下的戰鬥員和平民，其生命、尊嚴、個人權利與政治、宗教等信念均應受到尊重。他們應受到保護，免受各種暴力與報復行為的傷害。他們應有權與家人通信，以及接受救援。
